intro: Ebenus acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed evening-primrose, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Ebenus acuminata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
